abstract: Preliminary accident report finds that air traffic controller directed pilot Joseph Milo to nonexistent landing strip before his single-engine aircraft crashed in Hicksville, NY; Milo was killed and his passenger was injured.
lead_paragraph: An air traffic controller guided the pilot to a landing strip that is now occupied by industrial buildings, according to a report issued by the National Transportation Safety Board.

headline.main: Pilot in Fatal Long Island Crash Was Directed to Nonexistent Runway, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Pilot in Crash Was Directed to Closed Strip

snippet: An air traffic controller guided the pilot to a landing strip that is now occupied by industrial buildings, according to a report issued by the National Transportation Safety Board.
